lead_paragraph: The next president will test either Senator Mitch McConnell’s belief that bipartisanship can lead to significant progress, or Speaker Paul D. Ryan’s preference for single-party control.

headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Chiefs of Two Minds on Split Power
headline.main: Mitch McConnell and Paul Ryan Are of Two Minds About Divided Government

snippet: The next president will test either Senator Mitch McConnell’s belief that bipartisanship can lead to significant progress, or Speaker Paul D. Ryan’s preference for single-party control....
abstract: Carl Hulse On Washington column details how House Speaker Paul Ryan and Sen Mitch McConnell, Republican majority leader, have differing views on value of divided government, with Ryan arguing that sharing power gets in way of governing; notes that one of two views will be tested by next presidency, but also observes that McConnell's pro-bipartisan stance has not been backed up by Pres Obama's tenure in office.
